alert.note: Alert for Boyle; Casey; Garrard; Lincoln (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:10PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN LINCOLN...GARRARD... BOYLE AND NORTHERN CASEY COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 710 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Danville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Danville, Stanford, Lancaster, Mccreary, Junction City, Boneyville, Alum Springs, Caldwell Manor, Parksville and Marksbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Kentucky.
